name: Original Rider-Waite Tarot Deck Cards- Free Shipping!
description:
Once considered revolutionary, the Rider-Waite deck has become the most popular tarot deck in the world, and has set the standard for hundreds of other tarot decks. The cards were drawn in 1909 by Pamela Colman Smith under the direction of Arthur Edward Waite. Smith's vibrant drawings transformed the standard tarot deck. 

"A unique feature of the Rider-Waite deck, and one of the of the principal reasons for its enduring popularity, is that all of the cards, including the Minor Arcana, depict full scenes with figures and symbols. Prior to the Rider-Waite Tarot, the pip cards of almost all tarot decks were marked only with the arrangement of the suit signs -- swords, wands, cups, and coins, or pentacles. The pictorial images on all the cards allow interpretations without the need to repeatedly consult explanatory text. The innovative Minor Arcana, and Pamela Colman Smith's ability to capture the subtleties of emotion and experience have made the Rider-Waite Tarot a model for the designs of many tarot packs." -- (from The Encyclopedia of Tarot, Volume III) 

Rider-Waite Tarot was named one of the Top Ten Tarot Decks of All Time by Aeclectic Tarot.

This is a like new deck, opened only to ensure all the cards were in it with the instruction booklet as well.  

This will ship free going ground economy.

name: Vietnam Deathcards- Propaganda from both sides!
description: A great piece of history from Vietnam.  These are Vietnam "deathcards".  These were propaganda that was passed from both sides to eachother.  I obtained these from a US Vietnam Veteran.  He had some crazy stories and I would not like to disclose how he obtained the vietcong card.  I was able to get one from each side to make a great set for collectors.  Free shipping!

name: Vintage Royal Typewriter Circa 1950
description: This is a vintage typewriter manufactured by Royal is Circa 1950.  It may even be older because I canot find any serial numbers of model numbers on the unit.  This is great for any collector of Royal's equipment. Please feel free to contact me on the contact link if you have any questions about this piece.

name: Vintage Wall Sconce Candle Holder- Manufactured by Wilton in Circa 1960
description: This is a unique candle holder that was Manufactured by Wilton is the late 50s early 60s.  This is heavy duty cast iron.  I have not seen many like it.  It was obtained through an estate sale where the grandfather purchased it because he was a Wilton collector.  This is great for any collector as well as anyone who would like a genuine piece from he past for their home.  Wilton is still around today so there any many people looking for this style to add to their collection.  It measures 8" tall and it is free shipping going ground economy!
